resources.string: Aw, this wasn\'t supposed to happen! If you\'re seeing this, either the server is down or there was an error with the app displaying the result. Please try again at another time.

You can recycle this, but there is one condition; soiled cardboard goes in the garbage. If this is a pizza or donut box, for example. the grease makes recycling impossible. Otherwise, just be sure to shake away any food crumbs, remove packing tape and any plastic liners, and flatten the cardboard if it\'s a box, and in the recycling it goes!

This is most likely a glass container, like a bottle, mug, or jar, which you can basically recycle as is. Dump any residual food or oil into the compost and give the glass a quick rinse. If there\'s a metal cap or wine cork on top, you can recycle that, but it must be removed from the container first.

This one\'s an easy one! All metals are infinitely recyclable, INCLUDING clean aluminum foil, with the sole exception of aerosol cans that are partially full. Lightly rinse the object with water and you\'re good to go.

Virtually all forms of paper can be recycled! Newspapers, sticky notes, glossy magazines, colored paper, you name it. Make sure the paper is dry, and metal parts like staples and paper clips can be left on, although reusing paper clips is advisable. If your paper contains sensitive information, consider covering it with Sharpie instead of shredding it, which makes the paper last a shorter time due to the smaller wood fibers.

Hard plastic, like jugs, plastic bottles, and salad containers, are recyclable. Lightly rinse out the contents and put the plastic cap back on; it actually makes recyclers\' lives easier! Plastic wraps, films, and bags are trickier. To recycle these, you have to take them to storefront recycling bins at your nearest Walmart or Target.
Sometimes there\'s just nothing you can do! Find the nearest landfill bin and chuck this in."
Sorry, our app was stumped on this one! Make sure the object takes up the whole camera frame, no more, no less, and put it on a well-lit, white surface for better results.
